dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Did you know that March 2025 in Kazakhstan broke temperature records that had stood for over 80 years?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Did you know that March twenty twenty five in Kazakhstan broke temperature records that had stood for over eighty years?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On March 21 in the East Kazakhstan region, the weather station in Semey recorded a daytime temperature of +14.6ÂC, exceeding the historical 81-year-old record from 1944 (+10.8ÂC).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw that—like, in Semey, they hit +14.6°C, which beat a record from all the way back in 1944.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that-like, in Semey, they hit +fourteen point six degrees c, which beat a record from all the way back in nineteen forty four.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On March 21 in the East Kazakhstan region, the weather station in Semey recorded a daytime temperature of +14.6ÂC, exceeding the historical 81-year-old record from 1944 (+10.8ÂC).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild, right? And it wasn't just one city—Uralsk reached +19.2°C on March 16th, way above their usual +12.1°C norm.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild, right? And it wasn't just one city-Uralsk reached +nineteen point two degrees c on March sixteenth, way above their usual +twelve point one degrees c norm.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For example, in Uralsk on March 16, the temperature reached +19.2ÂC, far above the climatic norm of +12.1ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then Aktobe the next day, uh, hit +13.4°C, which is also way warmer than normal for March.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then Aktobe the next day, uh, hit +thirteen point four degrees c, which is also way warmer than normal for March.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Aktobe on March 17, temperatures rose to +13.4ÂC (+9.3ÂC norm).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and these records just kept falling—Petropavl, Kokshetau, Kostanay… it's like the whole country was heating up at once.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and these records just kept falling-Petropavl, Kokshetau, Kostanay... it's like the whole country was heating up at once.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Petropavl on March 18, the temperature reached +10.9ÂC, breaking the 2023 record of +4.0ÂC. In Kokshetau on March 18"19, the thermometer hit +11.9ÂC, breaking the 2013 record of +7.4ÂC and the 1970 record of +6.1ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, even Astana, which is usually freezing that time of year, had its highest ever March 20th temp at +9.1°C.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, even Astana, which is usually freezing that time of year, had its highest ever March twentieth temp at +nine point one degrees c.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Astana on March 20, the temperature was +9.1ÂC"the highest ever recorded for that date, surpassing the 2016 figure of +7.1ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Almaty—wow, +24.8°C on March 21st? That's almost summer weather!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Almaty-wow, +twenty four point eight degrees c on March twenty first? That's almost summer weather!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Almaty on March 18, temperatures reached +19.5ÂC, beating the 2001 record of +19.2ÂC. On March 21, the maximum temperature rose to +24.8ÂC, surpassing the previous 2018 record of +23.1ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But it wasn't all sunshine, you know—the report also mentioned extreme swings, like snowstorms and squally winds in some regions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it wasn't all sunshine, you know-the report also mentioned extreme swings, like snowstorms and squally winds in some regions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: March also brought extreme weather events across various regions, including sharp temperature swings, fog, snowstorms, and squally winds.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, which just shows how unpredictable and intense climate patterns are becoming.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, which just shows how unpredictable and intense climate patterns are becoming.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Do you think this is gonna be the new normal for Kazakhstan, or was March 2025 just a crazy outlier?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Do you think this is gonna be the new normal for Kazakhstan, or was March twenty twenty five just a crazy outlier?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Hard to say, but when you break records set in the 1940s, it feels like something bigger is going on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hard to say, but when you break records set in the 1940s, it feels like something bigger is going on.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And Kazhydromet's data makes it pretty clear—this wasn't a fluke.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And Kazhydromet's data makes it pretty clear-this wasn't a fluke.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to data from the RSE "Kazhydromet," March 2025 was one of the warmest months in Kazakhstan over the past decade. The average temperature across the country exceeded the climate norm by 1"5 degrees.
